title: Evaluation of Public Health Emergency Management in China: A Systematic Review
text:
Previous research on a health emergency management assessment system typically targeted certain types of public health emergencies and lacked the exploration of health emergency management assessment systems based on the commonality of multiple types of public health emergencies
 Future research should explore the optimal methods of realizing China's health emergency management, evaluate relevance and commonality, and develop sound and applicable standardization of health emergency management assessment systems to meet the developing requirements of potential emergencies in China
 Laws, regulations and policy bases for health emergency management assessment also need to attend to differences and linkages between national health emergencies and national emergency laws, regulations, and policies
authors: Wang, Jia; Yuan, Beibei; Li, Zhengmao; Wang, Zhifeng

title: The evidence base of primary research in public health emergency preparedness: a scoping review and stakeholder consultation
text: Public health considerations for sheltering and evacuation: Gaps in this initial theme related to understanding the logistics and implementation challenges for public health measures such as evacuation
authors: Khan, Yasmin; Fazli, Ghazal; Henry, Bonnie; de Villa, Eileen; Tsamis, Charoula; Grant, Moira; Schwartz, Brian
